intro: Hieracium induticeps, commonly known as the rough-hairy hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 50 centimeters. Its leaves are hairy and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is an herbaceous plant that spreads through rhizomes and can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
